{{Day}}

==Events==
*[[1066]] &ndash; [[Edward the Confessor]] dies childless, sparking a succession crisis that will eventually lead to the [[Norman conquest of England]].
*[[1477]] &ndash; [[Battle of Nancy]]: [[Charles the Bold]] is killed and [[Duchy of Burgundy|Burgundy]] becomes part of [[France]].
*[[1500]] &ndash; Duke [[Ludovico Sforza]] conquers [[Milan]].
*[[1527]] &ndash; [[Felix Manz]], a leader of the [[Anabaptist]] congregation in [[Zurich]], [[Switzerland]], is [[Capital punishment|executed]] by [[drowning]].
*[[1554]] &ndash; A great fire occurs in [[Eindhoven]], [[Netherlands]].
*[[1675]] &ndash; [[Battle of Turckheim|Battle of Colmar]]: the French army beats [[Brandenburg]].
*[[1757]] &ndash; [[Louis XV of France]] survives an [[assassination]] attempt by [[Robert-François Damiens]], the last person to be [[Capital punishment|executed]] in France by [[Hanged, drawn and quartered|drawing and quartering]], the traditional and gruesome form of capital punishment used for [[regicide]]s.
*[[1781]] &ndash; [[American Revolutionary War]]: [[Richmond, Virginia]], is burned by [[Kingdom of Great Britain|British]] naval forces led by [[Benedict Arnold]].
*[[1846]] &ndash; The [[United States House of Representatives]] votes to stop sharing the [[Oregon Territory]] with the [[United Kingdom]].
*[[1895]] &ndash; [[Dreyfus affair]]: French army officer [[Alfred Dreyfus]] is stripped of his rank and sentenced to life imprisonment on [[Devil's Island]].
*[[1896]] &ndash; An [[Austria]]n newspaper reports that [[Wilhelm Röntgen]] has discovered a type of [[electromagnetic radiation|radiation]] later known as [[X-ray]]s.
*[[1900]] &ndash; [[Ireland|Irish]] leader [[John Redmond]] calls for a revolt against British rule.
*[[1909]] &ndash; [[Colombia]] recognizes the independence of [[Panama]].
*[[1911]] &ndash; [[Kappa Alpha Psi]], the world's second oldest and largest [[List of African American Greek and fraternal organizations|black fraternity]], is founded at [[Indiana University]].
*[[1912]] &ndash; The [[Prague Party Conference]] takes place.
*[[1913]] &ndash; [[First Balkan War]]: During the [[Battle of Lemnos (1913)|Battle of Lemnos]], [[Greece|Greek]] admiral [[Pavlos Kountouriotis]] forces the Turkish fleet to retreat to its base within the [[Dardanelles]], from which it did not venture for the rest of the war.
*[[1914]] &ndash; The [[Ford Motor Company]] announces an [[Eight-hour day|eight-hour workday]] and that it would pay a "[[living wage]]" of at least [[United States dollar|$]]5 for a day's labor.
*[[1919]] &ndash; The [[German Workers' Party]], which would become the [[Nazi Party]], is founded.
*[[1925]] &ndash; [[Nellie Tayloe Ross]] of [[Wyoming]] becomes the first female governor in the [[United States]].
*[[1933]] &ndash; Construction of the [[Golden Gate Bridge]] begins in [[San Francisco Bay]].
*[[1940]] &ndash; [[FM broadcasting|FM radio]] is demonstrated to the [[Federal Communications Commission]] for the first time.
*[[1944]] &ndash; The ''[[Daily Mail]]'' becomes the first transoceanic newspaper.
*[[1945]] &ndash; The [[Soviet Union]] recognizes the new pro-Soviet government of [[Poland]].
*[[1949]] &ndash; [[President of the United States|United States President]] [[Harry S. Truman]] unveils his [[Fair Deal]] program.
*[[1957]] &ndash; In a speech given to the [[United States Congress]], United States President [[Dwight D. Eisenhower]] announces the establishment of what will later be called the [[Eisenhower Doctrine]].
*[[1968]] &ndash; [[Alexander Dubček]] comes to power: "[[Prague Spring]]" begins in [[Czechoslovakia]].
*[[1969]] &ndash; [[The Troubles]]: The [[Royal Ulster Constabulary]] raid the [[Bogside]] area of [[Derry]], damaging property and beating residents. In response, residents erect barricades and establish [[Free Derry]].
*[[1972]] &ndash; United States President [[Richard Nixon]] orders the development of a [[Space Shuttle]] program.
*[[1974]] &ndash; An [[earthquake]] in [[Lima]], [[Peru]], kills six people, and damages hundreds of houses.
*  1974   &ndash; Warmest reliably measured temperature in [[Antarctica]] of +59&nbsp;°F (+15&nbsp;°C) recorded at [[Vanda Station]]
*[[1975]] &ndash; The [[Tasman Bridge]] in [[Tasmania]], [[Australia]], [[Tasman Bridge disaster|is struck]] by the bulk ore carrier ''Lake Illawarra'', killing twelve people.
*[[1976]] &ndash; The [[Khmer Rouge]] proclaim the Constitution of [[Democratic Kampuchea]].
*  1976   &ndash; The Troubles: In response to the [[Reavey and O'Dowd killings|killing of six Catholics]] the night before, gunmen [[Kingsmill massacre|shoot dead ten Protestant civilians]] after stopping their minibus at Kingsmill in [[County Armagh]], [[Northern Ireland]], UK.
*[[1991]] &ndash; [[Georgia (country)|Georgian]] forces enter [[Tskhinvali]], the capital of [[South Ossetia|South Ossetia, Georgia]], opening the [[1991–1992 South Ossetia War]].
*[[1993]] &ndash; The oil tanker [[MV Braer|MV ''Braer'']] runs aground on the coast of the [[Shetland]] Islands, spilling 84,700 tons of crude oil.
*[[2005]] &ndash; [[Eris (dwarf planet)|Eris]], the largest known [[dwarf planet]] in the [[Solar System]], is discovered by the team of [[Michael E. Brown]], [[Chad Trujillo]], and [[David L. Rabinowitz]] using images originally taken on October 21, 2003, at the [[Palomar Observatory]].
